decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent. Reason: As required by Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Structure in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS8 of the Core Strategy, and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

During the construction phase of the development, no works (including any deliveries) shall take place on site outside of the following hours:08:00 to 18:00 Monday to Friday08:00 to 13:00 on SaturdaysNo works or deliveries whatsoever shall take place on Sundays or bank holidays.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans. The details of the paint type including colour and finish shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA prior to applying on the timber windows. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
description: Installation of new timber windows and reglazing existing windows.
